   19: %%
   20: -module(erl_lint_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %%-define(debug, true).
   23: 
   24: -ifdef(debug).
   25: -define(line, put(line, ?LINE), ).
   26: -define(config(X,Y), foo).
   27: -define(datadir, "erl_lint_SUITE_data").
   28: -define(privdir, "erl_lint_SUITE_priv").
   29: -define(t, test_server).
   30: -else.
   31: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   32: -define(datadir, proplists:get_value(data_dir, Conf)).
   33: -define(privdir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Conf)).
   34: -endif.
   35: 
   36: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0]).
   37: 
   38: -export([unused_vars_warn_basic/1,
   39:          unused_vars_warn_lc/1,
   40:          unused_vars_warn_rec/1,
   41:          unused_vars_warn_fun/1,
   42:          unused_vars_OTP_4858/1,
   43:          unused_unsafe_vars_warn/1,
   44:          export_vars_warn/1,
   45:          shadow_vars/1,
   46:          unused_import/1,
   47:          unused_function/1,
   48:          unsafe_vars/1,unsafe_vars2/1,
   49:          unsafe_vars_try/1,
   50:          unsized_binary_in_bin_gen_pattern/1,
   51:          guard/1, otp_4886/1, otp_4988/1, otp_5091/1, otp_5276/1, otp_5338/1,
   52:          otp_5362/1, otp_5371/1, otp_7227/1, otp_5494/1, otp_5644/1, otp_5878/1,
   53:          otp_5917/1, otp_6585/1, otp_6885/1, otp_10436/1, otp_11254/1,
   54:          otp_11772/1, otp_11771/1, otp_11872/1,
   55:          export_all/1,
   56:          bif_clash/1,
   57:          behaviour_basic/1, behaviour_multiple/1, otp_11861/1,
   58:          otp_7550/1,
   59:          otp_8051/1,
   60:          format_warn/1,
   61:          on_load_successful/1, on_load_failing/1,
   62:          too_many_arguments/1,
   63:          basic_errors/1,bin_syntax_errors/1,
   64:          predef/1,
   65:          maps/1,maps_type/1,maps_parallel_match/1,
   66:          otp_11851/1,otp_11879/1,otp_13230/1,
   67:          record_errors/1, otp_11879_cont/1,
   68:          non_latin1_module/1, illegal_module_name/1, otp_14323/1,
   69:          stacktrace_syntax/1,
   70:          otp_14285/1, otp_14378/1,
   71:          external_funs/1,otp_15456/1,otp_15563/1,
   72:          unused_type/1,binary_types/1,removed/1, otp_16516/1,
   73:          inline_nifs/1,
   74:          undefined_nifs/1,
   75:          no_load_nif/1,
   76:          warn_missing_spec/1,
   77:          otp_16824/1,
   78:          underscore_match/1,
   79:          unused_record/1,
   80:          unused_type2/1,
   81:          eep49/1]).
   82: 
   83: suite() ->
   84:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   85:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   86: 
   87: all() -> 
   88:     [{group, unused_vars_warn}, export_vars_warn,
   89:      shadow_vars, unused_import, unused_function,
   90:      unsafe_vars, unsafe_vars2, unsafe_vars_try, guard,
   91:      unsized_binary_in_bin_gen_pattern,
   92:      otp_4886, otp_4988, otp_5091, otp_5276, otp_5338,
   93:      otp_5362, otp_5371, otp_7227, otp_5494, otp_5644,
   94:      otp_5878, otp_5917, otp_6585, otp_6885, otp_10436, otp_11254,
   95:      otp_11772, otp_11771, otp_11872, export_all,
   96:      bif_clash, behaviour_basic, behaviour_multiple, otp_11861,
   97:      otp_7550, otp_8051, format_warn, {group, on_load},
   98:      too_many_arguments, basic_errors, bin_syntax_errors, predef,
   99:      maps, maps_type, maps_parallel_match,
  100:      otp_11851, otp_11879, otp_13230,
  101:      record_errors, otp_11879_cont,
  102:      non_latin1_module, illegal_module_name, otp_14323,
  103:      stacktrace_syntax, otp_14285, otp_14378, external_funs,
  104:      otp_15456, otp_15563, unused_type, binary_types, removed, otp_16516,
  105:      undefined_nifs,
  106:      no_load_nif,
  107:      inline_nifs, warn_missing_spec, otp_16824,
  108:      underscore_match, unused_record, unused_type2,
  109:      eep49].
  110: 
  111: groups() -> 
  112:     [{unused_vars_warn, [],
  113:       [unused_vars_warn_basic, unused_vars_warn_lc,
  114:        unused_vars_warn_rec, unused_vars_warn_fun,
  115:        unused_vars_OTP_4858, unused_unsafe_vars_warn]},
  116:      {on_load, [], [on_load_successful, on_load_failing]}].
  117: 
  118: 
  119: %% Warnings for unused variables in some simple cases.
  120: unused_vars_warn_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  121:     Ts = [{basic1,
  122:            <<"f(F) -> % F unused.
  123:                 ok.
  124: 
  125: f(F, F) ->
  126:     ok.
  127: 
  128: g(_X) ->
  129:     y.
  130: 
  131: h(P) ->
  132:     P.
  133: 
  134: x(N) ->
  135:     case a:b() of
  136: 	[N|Y] -> % Y unused.
  137: 	    ok
  138:     end.
  139: 
  140: y(N, L) ->
  141:     lists:map(fun(T) -> T*N end, L).
  142: 
  143: z(N, L) -> % N unused
  144:     lists:map(fun(N, T) -> T*N end, L).  % N shadowed.
  145: 
  146: 
  147: c(A) ->
  148:     case A of
  149: 	1 -> B = []; % B unused.
  150: 	2 -> B = []; % B unused.
  151: 	3 -> B = f, B
  152:     end.
  153: ">>,
  154: 	   [warn_unused_vars],
  155: {warnings,[{{1,23},erl_lint,{unused_var,'F'}},
  156: 	   {{15,5},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  157: 	   {{22,3},erl_lint,{unused_var,'N'}},
  158: 	   {{23,19},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'N','fun'}},
  159: 	   {{28,7},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  160: 	   {{29,7},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}}]}},
  161:           {basic2,
  162:            <<"-record(r, {x,y}).
  163:               f({X,Y}) -> {Z=X,Z=Y};
  164:               f([H|T]) -> [Z=H|Z=T];
  165:               f(#r{x=X,y=Y}) -> #r{x=A=X,y=A=Y}.
  166:               g({M, F}) -> (Z=M):(Z=F)();
  167:               g({M, F, Arg}) -> (Z=M):F(Z=Arg).
  168:               h(X, Y) -> (Z=X) + (Z=Y).">>,
  169:            [warn_unused_vars], []}],
  170:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  171:     ok.
  172: 
  173: %% Warnings for unused variables in list comprehensions.
  174: unused_vars_warn_lc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  175:     Ts = [{lc1, 
  176:            <<"bin([X]) ->
  177:                   [A || <<A:X>> <- []]; % X used, not shadowed.
  178:               bin({X}) ->
  179:                   [X || <<X:X>> <- []]; % X used, and shadowed.
  180:               bin({X,Y,Z}) ->
  181:                   [{A,B} || <<A:X>> <- Z, <<B:Y>> <- Z];
  182:               bin([X,Y,Z]) -> % Y unused.
  183:                   [C || <<V:X>> <- Z, <<B:V>> <- Z, <<C:B>> <- Z].
  184:            ">>, 
  185:            [warn_unused_vars],
  186:            {warnings, [{{4,27},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  187:                        {{7,22},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}}]}},
  188: 
  189:           {lc2,
  190:            <<"bin([X]) ->
  191:                   [A || <<A:X>> <- []]; % X used, not shadowed.
  192:               bin({X}) ->
  193:                   [X || <<X:X>> <- []]; % X used, and shadowed.
  194:               bin({X,Y,Z}) ->
  195:                   [{A,B} || <<A:X>> <- Z, <<B:Y>> <- Z];
  196:               bin([X,Y,Z]) -> % Y unused.
  197:                   [C || <<V:X>> <- Z, <<B:V>> <- Z, <<C:B>> <- Z].
  198:            ">>,
  199:            [warn_unused_vars],
  200:            {warnings,[{{4,27},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  201:                       {{7,22},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}}]}},
  202: 
  203:           {lc3,
  204:            <<"a([A]) ->
  205:                   B = foo,
  206:                   [{C,B} || {C,_} <- A];
  207:               a({A}) ->
  208:                   B = foo,
  209:                   [C || {C,_} <- [B,A]];
  210:               a({A,A}) ->
  211:                   B = foo,
  212:                   [C || {C,_} <- B, B < A].
  213:            ">>,
  214:            [warn_unused_vars],
  215:            []},
  216: 
  217:           {lc4,
  218:            <<"b(A) ->
  219:                   B = foo, % B unused.
  220:                   [C || {C,_} <- A].
  221:            ">>,
  222:            [warn_unused_vars],
  223:            {warnings,[{{2,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}}]}},
  224: 
  225:           {lc5,
  226:            <<"c(A) ->
  227:                   B = foo,
  228:                   [C || {C,_} <- A],
  229:                   B.
  230:            ">>,
  231:            [warn_unused_vars],
  232:            []},
  233: 
  234:           {lc6,
  235:            <<"d(A) ->
  236:                   B = foo,
  237:                   [{A,B} || {Id,_} <- A]. % Id unused.
  238:            ">>,
  239:            [warn_unused_vars],
  240:            {warnings,[{{3,30},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Id'}}]}},
  241: 
  242:           {lc7,
  243:            <<"e(A) ->
  244:                   B = foo, % B unused.
  245:                   [B || B <- A]. % B shadowed.
  246:            ">>,
  247:            [warn_unused_vars],
  248:            {warnings,[{{2,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  249:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'B',generate}}]}},
  250: 
  251:           {lc8,
  252:            <<"f(A) ->
  253:                   B = foo,
  254:                   [B || B <- A], % B shadowed.
  255:                   B.
  256:            ">>,
  257:            [warn_unused_vars],
  258:            {warnings,[{{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'B',generate}}]}},
  259: 
  260:           {lc9,
  261:            <<"g(A) ->
  262:                   B = foo, % B unused.
  263:                   [A || B <- A]. % B shadowed, B unused.
  264:            ">>,
  265:            [warn_unused_vars],
  266:            {warnings,[{{2,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  267:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  268:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'B',generate}}]}},
  269: 
  270:           {lc10,
  271:            <<"h(A) ->
  272:                   B = foo,
  273:                   [A || B <- A], % B shadowed, B unused.
  274:                   B.
  275:            ">>,
  276:            [warn_unused_vars],
  277:            {warnings,[{{3,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  278:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'B',generate}}]}},
  279: 
  280:           {lc11,
  281:            <<"i(X) ->
  282:                   [Z || Z <- X, % Z unused.
  283:                         Z = X <- [foo]]. % X and Z shadowed. X unused!
  284:            ">>,
  285:            [warn_unused_vars],
  286:            {warnings,[{{2,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  287:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}},
  288:                       {{3,29},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  289:                       {{3,29},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}}]}},
  290: 
  291:           {lc12,
  292:            <<"j({X}) ->
  293:                   [Z || Z <- X, % Z unused.
  294:                         Z <- X = [[1,2,3]], % Z shadowed. Z unused.
  295:                         Z <- X, % Z shadowed. Z unused.
  296:                         Z <- X]; % Z shadowed.
  297:               j(X) ->
  298:                   [foo || X <- X, % X shadowed.
  299:                         X <-    % X shadowed. X unused.
  300:                              X = 
  301:                                  Y = [[1,2,3]], % Y unused.
  302:                         X <- [], % X shadowed.
  303:                         X <- X]. % X shadowed. X unused.
  304:            ">>,
  305:            [warn_unused_vars],
  306:            {warnings,[{{2,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  307:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  308:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}},
  309:                       {{4,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  310:                       {{4,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}},
  311:                       {{5,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}},
  312:                       {{7,27},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  313:                       {{8,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  314:                       {{8,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  315:                       {{10,34},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  316:                       {{11,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  317:                       {{12,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  318:                       {{12,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}}]}},
  319: 
  320:           {lc13,
  321:            <<"k(X) ->
  322:                   [Z || Z <- Y = X]; % Y unused.
  323:               k(X) ->
  324:                   [Z || Z <- X = Y = X]; % Y unused!
  325:               k(X) ->
  326:                   [Z || Z <- begin X = Y = X, Y end];
  327:               k(X) ->
  328:                   [{Y,W} || W <- Y = X]; % Y unbound
  329:               k(X) ->
  330:                   [Z || Z <- (Y = X), % Y unused.
  331:                        Y > X]; % Y unbound.
  332:               k(X) ->
  333:                   [Y || Y = X > 3, Z = X]; % Z unused.
  334:               k(X) ->
  335:                   [Z || Y = X > 3, Z = X]. % Y unused.
  336:            ">>,
  337:            [warn_unused_vars],
  338:            {error,[{{8,21},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'Y'}},
  339:                    {{11,24},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'Y'}}],
  340:                   [{{2,30},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  341:                    {{4,34},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  342:                    {{8,34},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  343:                    {{10,31},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  344:                    {{13,36},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  345:                    {{15,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}}]}},
  346: 
  347:           {lc14,
  348:            <<"lc2() ->
  349:                   Z = [[1],[2],[3]], 
  350:                   [X || Z <- Z, % Z shadowed.
  351:                         X <- Z].
  352:            ">>,
  353:            [warn_unused_vars],
  354:            {warnings,[{{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}}]}},
  355: 
  356:           {lc15,
  357:            <<"lc3() ->
  358:                   Z = [1,2,3], 
  359:                   [X || X <- Z, 
  360:                         Z <- Z]. % Z shadowed. Z unused.
  361:            ">>,
  362:            [warn_unused_vars],
  363:            {warnings,[{{4,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  364:                       {{4,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}}]}},
  365: 
  366:           {lc16,
  367:            <<"bin(Z) ->
  368:                   case bar of
  369:                       true ->
  370:                           U = 2;
  371:                       false ->
  372:                           true
  373:                   end,
  374:                   case bar of
  375:                       true ->
  376:                           X = 2;
  377:                       false ->
  378:                           X = 3
  379:                   end,
  380:                   case foo of
  381:                       true ->
  382:                           Y = 3; % Y unused.
  383:                       false ->
  384:                           4
  385:                   end,
  386:                   case foo of
  387:                       1 ->
  388:                           U; % U unsafe.
  389:                       2 ->
  390:                           [Z || <<U:X>> <- Z]; % (X exported.) U unused.
  391:                       3 ->
  392:                           [Z || <<U:X>> <- Z], % (X exported.) U unused.
  393:                           U % U unsafe.
  394:                   end.
  395:            ">>,
  396:            [warn_unused_vars],
  397:            {error,[{{22,27},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'U',{'case',{2,19}}}},
  398:                    {{27,27},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'U',{'case',{2,19}}}}],
  399:             [{{16,27},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  400:              {{24,35},erl_lint,{unused_var,'U'}},
  401:              {{26,35},erl_lint,{unused_var,'U'}}]}},
  402: 
  403:           {lc17,
  404:            <<"bin(Z) ->
  405:                   %% This used to pass erl_lint...
  406:                   case bar of
  407:                       true ->
  408:                           U = 2;
  409:                       false ->
  410:                           true
  411:                   end,
  412:                   case bar of
  413:                       true ->
  414:                           X = 2;
  415:                       false ->
  416:                           X = 3
  417:                   end,
  418:                   case foo of
  419:                       true ->
  420:                           Y = 3; % Y unused.
  421:                       false ->
  422:                           4
  423:                   end,
  424:                   [Z || <<U:X>> <- Z], % (X exported.) U unused.
  425:                   U. % U unsafe.
  426:            ">>,
  427:            [warn_unused_vars],
  428:            {error,[{{22,19},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'U',{'case',{3,19}}}}],
  429:             [{{17,27},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  430:              {{21,27},erl_lint,{unused_var,'U'}}]}},
  431: 
  432:           {lc18,
  433:            <<"bin(Z) ->
  434:                   case bar of
  435:                       true ->
  436:                           U = 2;
  437:                       false ->
  438:                           true
  439:                   end,
  440:                   case bar of
  441:                       true ->
  442:                           X = 2;
  443:                       false ->
  444:                           X = 3
  445:                   end,
  446:                   case foo of
  447:                       true ->
  448:                           Y = 3;
  449:                       false ->
  450:                           4
  451:                   end,
  452:                   [B || <<U: % U unused
  453:                           U>> <- X, <<B:Y>> <- Z]. % U unsafe. Y unsafe. 
  454: 						% U shadowed. (X exported.)
  455:            ">>,
  456:            [warn_unused_vars],
  457:            {error,[{{21,27},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'U',{'case',{2,19}}}},
  458:                    {{21,41},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'Y',{'case',{14,19}}}}],
  459:             [{{20,27},erl_lint,{unused_var,'U'}}
  460:             ]}},
  461: 
  462:           {lc19,
  463:            <<"p({B,C}) ->
  464:                   <<A:B,A:C>> = <<17:32>>;
  465:               p(B) ->
  466:                   <<A:B>> = <<17:32>>. % A unused.
  467:            ">>,
  468:            [warn_unused_vars],
  469:            {warnings,[{{4,21},erl_lint,{unused_var,'A'}}]}},
  470: 
  471:           {lc20,
  472:            <<"c({I1,I2}) ->
  473:                   if
  474:                       <<I1:I2>> == <<>> ->
  475:                           foo
  476:                   end;
  477:               c([C1,C2]) -> % C1 unused.
  478:                   case foo of
  479:                       <<C2:C2,
  480:                         C3:C2>> -> % C3 unused.
  481:                           bar
  482:                   end.
  483: 
  484:            ">>,
  485:            [warn_unused_vars],
  486:            {warnings,[{{6,18},erl_lint,{unused_var,'C1'}},
  487:                       {{7,19},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,no_clause}},
  488:                       {{9,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'C3'}}]}},
  489: 
  490:           {lc21,
  491:            <<"t() ->
  492:                   S = 8,
  493:                   case <<3:8>> of
  494:                       <<X:S>> ->
  495:                           X;
  496:                       <<S:X>> -> % X unbound
  497:                           foo
  498:                   end;
  499:               t() ->
  500:                   S = 8,
  501:                   case <<3:8>> of
  502:                       <<S:S>> ->
  503:                           S;
  504:                       <<Q:32>> -> % Q unused.
  505:                           foo
  506:                   end.
  507:            ">>,
  508:            [warn_unused_vars],
  509:            {error,[{{6,27},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'X'}}],
  510:                   [{{14,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Q'}}]}}
  511: 
  512:           ],
  513:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  514:     ok.
  515: 
  516: 
  517: %% Warnings for unused variables in records.
  518: unused_vars_warn_rec(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  519:     Ts = [{rec1, % An example provided by Bjorn.
  520:            <<"-record(edge,
  521:                       {ltpr,
  522:                        ltsu,
  523:                        rtpr,
  524:                        rtsu
  525:                       }).
  526: 
  527:               f1(#edge{ltpr = A, ltsu = A}) ->
  528:                   true;
  529:               f1({Q, Q}) ->
  530:                   true.
  531: 
  532:               f2(Edge, Etab) ->
  533:                   case gb_trees:lookup(Edge, Etab) of
  534:                       {value,#edge{ltpr=Same,ltsu=Same}} -> ok;
  535:                       {value,_} -> error
  536:                   end.
  537: 
  538:               bar(Edge, Etab) ->
  539:                   case gb_trees:lookup(Edge, Etab) of
  540:                       {Same,Same} -> ok;
  541:                       {value,#edge{ltpr=Same}} -> ok; % Same unused.
  542:                       {value,_} -> error
  543:                   end.
  544:            ">>,
  545:            [warn_unused_vars],

  547:           {rec2,

  572: %% Warnings for unused variables in funs.
  573: unused_vars_warn_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->

  761: %% Warnings for exported variables.
  762: export_vars_warn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  763:     Ts = [{exp1,
  764:            <<"u() ->
  765:                   case foo of
  766:                       1 ->
  767:                           A = 1,
  768:                           B = 2,
  769:                           W = 3, % W unused.
  770:                           Z = 3; % Z unused.
  771:                       2 ->
  772:                           B = 2,
  773:                           Z = 4 % Z unused.
  774:                   end,
  775:                   case bar of
  776:                       true ->
  777:                           A = 17, % A unsafe.
  778:                           X = 3, % X unused.
  779:                           U = 2,
  780:                           U;
  781:                       false ->
  782:                           B = 19, % B exported.
  783:                           U = 3; % U unused.
  784:                       foo ->
  785:                           X = 3,
  786:                           X;

  788:                           X = 9, % X unused.

  790:                   end.
  791:            ">>,
  792:            [warn_unused_vars],

  801:                    {{26,27},erl_lint,{unused_var,'U'}}]}},

  854: %% Shadowed variables are tested in other places, but here we test
  855: %% that the warning can be turned off.
  856: shadow_vars(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  857:     Ts = [{shadow1,
  858: 	   <<"bin(A) ->
  859:                   receive
  860:                       M ->
  861:                            X = M,
  862:                            Y = M,
  863:                            Z = M
  864:                   end,
  865:                   [B || <<B:X>> <- A],
  866:                   Y = B,
  867:                   [B || B <- Z]. % B shadowed.
  868:            ">>,
  869: 	   [nowarn_shadow_vars],
  870: 	   {error,[{{9,23},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'B'}}],
  871: 	    [{{9,19},erl_lint,{exported_var,'Y',{'receive',{2,19}}}}]}},
  872:           {shadow2,
  873:            <<"t() ->
  874:                   _ = (catch MS = MS = 1), % MS used unsafe
  875:                   _ = case ok of _ -> fun() -> ok end end,
  876:                   fun (MS) -> MS end. % MS not shadowed here
  877:            ">>,
  878:            [],
  879:            []}],
  880:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  881:     ok.
  882: 
  883: %% Test that the 'warn_unused_import' option works.
  884: unused_import(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  885:     Ts = [{imp1,
  886: 	   <<"-import(lists, [map/2,foldl/3]).
  887:               t(L) ->
  888:                  map(fun(X) -> 2*X end, L).
  889:            ">>,

  894: 
  895: %% Test warnings for unused functions.
  896: unused_function(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  897:     Ts = [{func1,
  898: 	   <<"-export([t/1]).
  899:               t(L) ->
  900:                  lists:map(fun(X) -> 2*X end, L).
  901: 
  902:               fact(N) ->
  903:                 fact_1(N, 1).
  904: 
  905:               fact_1(1, P) -> P;
  906:               fact_1(N, P) -> fact_1(N-1, P*N).
  907:            ">>,
  908: 	   {[]},				%Tuple indicates no 'export_all'.
  909: 	   {warnings,[{{5,15},erl_lint,{unused_function,{fact,1}}},
  910: 		      {{8,15},erl_lint,{unused_function,{fact_1,2}}}]}},
  911: 
  912: 	  %% Turn off warnings for unused functions.
  913: 	  {func2,
  914: 	   <<"-export([t/1]).
  915:               t(L) ->
  916:                  lists:map(fun(X) -> 2*X end, L).
  917: 
  918:               b(X) ->
  919:                 32*X.
  920:            ">>,
  921: 	   {[nowarn_unused_function]},         %Tuple indicates no 'export_all'.
  922: 	   []},
  923: 
  924: 	  %% Turn off warnings for unused functions using a -compile() directive.
  925: 	  {func3,
  926: 	   <<"-export([t/1]).
  927:               -compile(nowarn_unused_function).
  928: 
  929:               t(L) ->
  930:                  lists:map(fun(X) -> 2*X end, L).
  931: 
  932:               b(X) ->
  933:                 32*X.
  934:            ">>,
  935: 	   {[]},		     %Tuple indicates no 'export_all'.
  936: 	   []}],
  937: 
  938:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  939:     ok.
  940:

  979: %% OTP-4671. Errors for unsafe variables.
  980: unsafe_vars(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  981:     Ts = [{unsafe1,
  982:            <<"t() ->
  983:                  (X = true) orelse (Y = false),
  984:                   Y.
  985:            ">>,
  986:            [warn_unused_vars],
  987:            {error,[{{3,19},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'Y',{'orelse',{2,29}}}}],
  988:             [{{2,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}}]}},
  989:           {unsafe2,
  990:            <<"t2() ->
  991:                   (X = true) orelse (Y = false),
  992:                   X.
  993:            ">>,
  994:            [warn_unused_vars],
  995:            {warnings,[{{2,38},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}}]}},
  996:           {unsafe3,
  997:            <<"t3() ->
  998:                   (X = true) andalso (Y = false),
  999:                   Y.
 1000:            ">>,
 1001:            [warn_unused_vars],
 1002:            {error,[{{3,19},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'Y',{'andalso',{2,30}}}}],
 1003:             [{{2,20},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}}]}},
 1004:           {unsafe4,
 1005:            <<"t4() ->
 1006:                   (X = true) andalso (true = X),
 1007:                   X.
 1008:            ">>,
 1009:            [warn_unused_vars],
 1010:            []},
 1011:           {unsafe5,
 1012:            <<"t5() ->
 1013:                   Y = 3,
 1014:                   (X = true) andalso (X = true),
 1015:                   {X,Y}.
 1016:            ">>,
 1017:            [warn_unused_vars],
 1018:            []},
 1019:           {unsafe6,
 1020:            <<"t6() ->
 1021:                   X = true,
 1022:                   (X = true) andalso (true = X),
 1023:                   X.
 1024:            ">>,
 1025:            [warn_unused_vars],
 1026:            []},
 1027:           {unsafe7,
 1028:            <<"t7() ->
 1029:                   (if true -> X = 3; false -> true end) 
 1030:                       andalso (X > 2),
 1031:                   X.
 1032:            ">>,
 1033:            [warn_unused_vars],
 1034:            {errors,[{{3,32},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'X',{'if',{2,20}}}},
 1035:                     {{4,19},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'X',{'if',{2,20}}}}],
 1036:             []}},
 1037:           {unsafe8,
 1038:            <<"t8(X) ->
 1039:                   case X of _ -> catch _Y = 1 end,
 1040:                   _Y."
 1041:            >>,
 1042:            [],
 1043:            {errors,[{{3,19},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'_Y',{'catch',{2,34}}}}],
 1044:             []}},
 1045:            {unsafe9,
 1046:            <<"t9(X) ->
 1047:                   case X of
 1048:                       1 ->
 1049:                           catch A = 1, % unsafe only here
 1050:                           B = 1,
 1051:                           C = 1,
 1052:                           D = 1;
 1053:                       2 ->
 1054:                           A = 2,
 1055:                           %% B not bound here
 1056:                           C = 2,
 1057:                           catch D = 2; % unsafe in two clauses
 1058:                       3 ->
 1059:                           A = 3,
 1060:                           B = 3,
 1061:                           C = 3,
 1062:                           catch D = 3; % unsafe in two clauses
 1063:                       4 ->
 1064:                           A = 4,
 1065:                           B = 4,
 1066:                           C = 4,
 1067:                           D = 4
 1068:                   end,
 1069:                   {A,B,C,D}."
 1070:            >>,
 1071:            [],
 1072:            {errors,[{{24,20},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'A',{'catch',{4,27}}}},
 1073:                     {{24,22},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'B',{'case',{2,19}}}},
 1074:                     {{24,26},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'D',{'case',{2,19}}}}],
 1075:             []}},
 1076:           {unsafe_comprehension,
 1077:            <<"foo() ->
 1078:                  case node() of
 1079:                      P when is_tuple(P) ->
 1080:                          P;
 1081:                      _ ->
 1082:                          ok
 1083:                  end,
 1084:                  Y = try
 1085:                          ok
 1086:                      catch _C:_R ->
 1087:                              [1 || _ <- []]
 1088:                      end,
 1089:                  case Y of
 1090:                      P ->
 1091:                          P
 1092:                  end.
 1093:            ">>,
 1094:            [],
 1095:            {errors,[{{14,22},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'P',{'case',{2,18}}}}],[]}}
 1096:          ],
 1097:     [] = run(Config, Ts),

 2142:             [{{2,16},erl_lint,disallowed_nowarn_bif_clash}],[]}},
 2143: 
 2144:           {otp_5362_7,
 2145:            <<"-export([spawn/1]).
 2146:               -compile({nowarn_deprecated_function,{erlang,now,0}}).
 2147:               -compile({nowarn_bif_clash,{spawn,1}}).
 2148:               -compile({nowarn_bif_clash,{spawn,2}}). % bad
 2149:               -compile([{nowarn_deprecated_function, 
 2150:                                 [{erlang,now,-1},{3,now,-1}]}, % 2 bad
 2151:                      {nowarn_deprecated_function, {{a,b,c},now,-1}}]). % bad
 2152:               spawn(A) ->
 2153:                   erlang:now(),
 2154:                   spawn(A).
 2155:            ">>,

 2169:                   spawn(A).

 2244: %% OTP-15456. All compiler options can now be given in the option list
 2245: %% (as opposed to only in files).
 2246: otp_15456(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2247:     Ts = [
 2248:           %% {nowarn_deprecated_function,[{M,F,A}]} can now be given
 2249:           %% in the option list as well as in an attribute.
 2250:           %% Wherever it occurs, it is not affected by
 2251:           %% warn_deprecated_function.
 2252:           {otp_15456_1,
 2253:            <<"-compile({nowarn_deprecated_function,{erlang,now,0}}).
 2254:               -export([foo/0]).
 2255: 
 2256:               foo() ->
 2257:                   {erlang:now(), random:seed0(), random:seed(1, 2, 3),
 2258:                    random:uniform(), random:uniform(42)}.
 2259:            ">>,
 2260:            {[{nowarn_deprecated_function,{random,seed0,0}},
 2261:              {nowarn_deprecated_function,[{random,uniform,0},
 2262:                                           {random,uniform,1}]},
 2263:              %% There should be no warnings when attempting to
 2264:              %% turn of warnings for functions that are not
 2265:              %% deprecated or not used in the module.
 2266:              {nowarn_deprecated_function,{random,uniform_s,1}},
 2267:              {nowarn_deprecated_function,{erlang,abs,1}},
 2268:              warn_deprecated_function]},
 2269:            {warnings,[{{5,50},erl_lint,
 2270:                        {deprecated,{random,seed,3},
 2271:                         "use the 'rand' module instead"}}]}},
 2272: 
 2273:           %% {nowarn_unused_function,[{M,F,A}]} can be given
 2274:           %% in the option list as well as in an attribute.
 2275:           %% It was incorrectly documented to only work when
 2276:           %% given in an attribute.
 2277:           {otp_15456_2,
 2278:            <<"-compile({nowarn_unused_function,foo/0}).
 2279:               foo() -> ok.
 2280:               bar() -> ok.
 2281:               foobar() -> ok.
 2282:               barf(_) -> ok.
 2283:               other() -> ok.
 2284:            ">>,
 2285:            {[{nowarn_unused_function,[{bar,0},{foobar,0}]},
 2286:              {nowarn_unused_function,{barf,1}},
 2287:              %% There should be no warnings when attempting to
 2288:              %% turn of warnings for unused functions that are not
 2289:              %% defined in the module.
 2290:              {nowarn_unused_function,{not_defined_in_module,1}},
 2291:              warn_unused_function]},
 2292:            {warnings,[{{6,15},erl_lint,{unused_function,{other,0}}}]}
 2293:           }],
 2294: 
 2295:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 2296:     ok.

 2603:               t() ->
 2604:                   case x() of

 2637:         run_test2(Config, Ill1, [warn_unused_record]),
 2638: 
 2639:     Ill2 = <<"-module(lint_test).
 2640:               -export([t/0]).
 2641:               t() ->
 2642:                   case x() of
 2643:                       _ when l() 
 2644:                              or
 2645:                              l() ->
 2646:                           foo
 2647:                   end.
 2648:              ">>,
 2649:     {errors,[{{4,24},erl_lint,{undefined_function,{x,0}}},
 2650:              {{5,30},erl_lint,illegal_guard_expr},
 2651:              {{7,30},erl_lint,illegal_guard_expr}],
 2652:            []} =
 2653:         run_test2(Config, Ill2, [warn_unused_record]),
 2654: 
 2655:     Ill3 = <<"t() -> ok.">>,
 2656:     {errors,[{{1,1},erl_lint,undefined_module}],[]} =
 2657:         run_test2(Config, Ill3, [warn_unused_record]),
 2658: 
 2659:     Usage1 = <<"-module(lint_test).
 2660:                 -export([t/0]).
 2661:                 -record(u1, {a}).
 2662:                 -record(u2, {a = #u1{}}).
 2663:                 -record(u3, {a}). % unused
 2664:                 -record(u4, {a = #u3{}}). % unused
 2665: 
 2666:                 t() ->
 2667:                     {#u2{}}.
 2668:                ">>,
 2669:     {warnings,[{{5,18},erl_lint,{unused_record,u3}},
 2670:                {{6,18},erl_lint,{unused_record,u4}}]} = 
 2671:         run_test2(Config, Usage1, [warn_unused_record]),
 2672: 
 2673:     Usage2 = <<"-module(lint_test).
 2674:                 -export([t/0]).
 2675:                 -record(u1, {a}).
 2676:                 -record(u2, {a = #u1{}}).
 2677:                 -file(\"some_file.hrl\", 1).
 2678:                 -record(u3, {a}). % unused, but on other file
 2679:                 -record(u4, {a = #u3{}}). % -\"-
 2680: 
 2681:                 t() ->
 2682:                     {#u2{}}.
 2683:                ">>,
 2684:     [] = run_test2(Config, Usage2, [warn_unused_record]),
 2685: 
 2686:     %% This a completely different story...

 2689:               -import(qlc, [q/2]).
 2690:               -export([t/0]).

 2692:               t() ->
 2693:                   H1 = qlc:q([X || X <- [1,2]]),

 2695:                   H3 = q([X || X <- [1,2]], []),
 2696:                   {H1,H2,H3}.
 2697:              ">>,
 2698:     {warnings,[{{6,24},erl_lint,{missing_qlc_hrl,1}},
 2699:                {{7,24},erl_lint,{missing_qlc_hrl,2}},
 2700:                {{8,24},erl_lint,{missing_qlc_hrl,2}}]} =
 2701:         run_test2(Config, QLC2, [warn_unused_record]),
 2702: 
 2703:     %% Records that are used by types are not unused.
 2704:     %% (Thanks to Fredrik Thulin and Kostis Sagonas.)
 2705:     UsedByType = <<"-module(t).
 2706:                     -export([foo/1]).
 2707:                     -record(sipurl,  {host :: string()}).
 2708:                     -record(keylist, {list = [] :: [_]}).
 2709:                     -type sip_headers() :: #keylist{}.
 2710:                     -record(request, {uri :: #sipurl{}, header :: sip_headers()}).
 2711: 
 2712:                     foo(#request{}) -> ok.
 2713:                   ">>,
 2714:     [] = run_test2(Config, UsedByType, [warn_unused_record]),
 2715: 
 2716:     %% Abstract code generated by OTP 18. Note that the type info for
 2717:     %% record fields has been put in a separate form.
 2718:     OldAbstract = [{attribute,1,file,{"rec.erl",1}},
 2719:                    {attribute,1,module,rec},
 2720:                    {attribute,3,export,[{t,0}]},
 2721:                    {attribute,7,record,{r,[{record_field,7,{atom,7,f}}]}},
 2722:                    {attribute,7,type,
 2723:                     {{record,r},
 2724:                      [{typed_record_field,
 2725:                        {record_field,7,{atom,7,f}},
 2726:                        {type,7,union,[{atom,7,undefined},{type,7,atom,[]}]}}],
 2727:                      []}},
 2728:                    {function,9,t,0,[{clause,9,[],[],[{record,10,r,[]}]}]},
 2729:                    {eof,11}],
 2730:     {error,[{"rec.erl",[{7,erl_lint,old_abstract_code}]}],[]} =
 2731:         compile_forms(OldAbstract, [return, report]),
 2732: 
 2733:     ok.

 2735: %% OTP-6885. Binary fields in bit syntax matching is now only
 2736: %% allowed at the end.
 2737: otp_6885(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2738:     Ts = <<"-module(otp_6885).
 2739:             -export([t/1]).
 2740:             t(<<_/binary,I>>) -> I;
 2741:             t(<<X/binary,I:X>>) -> I;
 2742: 	    t(<<B/binary,T/binary>>) -> {B,T}.
 2743: 
 2744:             build(A, B) ->
 2745:                <<A/binary,B/binary>>.
 2746: 
 2747:             foo(<<\"abc\"/binary>>) ->
 2748:                ok;
 2749:             foo(<<\"abc\":13/integer>>) ->
 2750:                ok;
 2751:             foo(<<\"abc\"/float>>) ->
 2752:                ok;
 2753:             foo(<<\"abc\":19>>) ->
 2754:                ok;
 2755:             foo(<<\"abc\"/utf8>>) ->
 2756:                ok;
 2757:             foo(<<\"abc\"/utf16>>) ->
 2758:                ok;
 2759:             foo(<<\"abc\"/utf32>>) ->
 2760:                ok.
 2761: 
 2762:            ">>,
 2763:     {errors,[{{3,17},erl_lint,unsized_binary_not_at_end},
 2764:              {{4,17},erl_lint,unsized_binary_not_at_end},
 2765:              {{5,10},erl_lint,unsized_binary_not_at_end},
 2766:              {{10,19},erl_lint,typed_literal_string},
 2767:              {{12,19},erl_lint,typed_literal_string},
 2768:              {{14,19},erl_lint,typed_literal_string},
 2769:              {{16,19},erl_lint,typed_literal_string}],
 2770: 	   []} = run_test2(Config, Ts, []),
 2771:     ok.

 2889: 
 2890: %% Test warnings for functions that clash with BIFs.
 2891: bif_clash(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2892:     Ts = [{clash1,
 2893:            <<"t(X) ->
 2894:                   size(X).
 2895: 
 2896:               %% No warning for the following calls, since they
 2897:               %% are unambigous.
 2898:               b(X) ->
 2899:                   erlang:size(X).
 2900: 
 2901:               c(X) ->
 2902:                   ?MODULE:size(X).
 2903: 
 2904:               size({N,_}) ->
 2905:                 N.
 2906:              ">>,
 2907:            [],
 2908: 	   {errors,[{{2,19},erl_lint,{call_to_redefined_old_bif,{size,1}}}],[]}},
 2909: 
 2910: 	  %% Verify that warnings cannot be turned off in the old way.
 2911: 	  {clash2,
 2912:            <<"-export([t/1,size/1]).
 2913:               t(X) ->
 2914:                   size(X).
 2915: 
 2916:               size({N,_}) ->
 2917:                 N.
 2918: 
 2919:               %% My own abs/1 function works on lists too. From R14 this really works.
 2920:               abs([H|T]) when $a =< H, H =< $z -> [H-($a-$A)|abs(T)];
 2921:               abs([H|T]) -> [H|abs(T)];
 2922:               abs([]) -> [];
 2923:               abs(X) -> erlang:abs(X).
 2924:              ">>,
 2925: 	   {[nowarn_unused_function,nowarn_bif_clash]},
 2926: 	   {errors,[{erl_lint,disallowed_nowarn_bif_clash}],[]}},
 2927: 	  %% As long as noone calls an overridden BIF, it's totally OK
 2928: 	  {clash3,
 2929:            <<"-export([size/1]).
 2930:               size({N,_}) ->
 2931:                 N;
 2932:               size(X) ->
 2933:                 erlang:size(X).
 2934:              ">>,
 2935: 	   [],
 2936: 	   []},
 2937: 	  %% But this is totally wrong - meaning of the program changed in R14, so this is an error
 2938: 	  {clash4,
 2939:            <<"-export([size/1]).
 2940:               size({N,_}) ->
 2941:                 N;
 2942:               size(X) ->
 2943:                 size(X).
 2944:              ">>,
 2945: 	   [],
 2946: 	   {errors,[{{5,17},erl_lint,{call_to_redefined_old_bif,{size,1}}}],[]}},
 2947: 	  %% For a post R14 bif, its only a warning
 2948: 	  {clash5,
 2949:            <<"-export([binary_part/2]).
 2950:               binary_part({B,_},{X,Y}) ->
 2951:                 binary_part(B,{X,Y});
 2952:               binary_part(B,{X,Y}) ->
 2953:                 binary:part(B,X,Y).
 2954:              ">>,
 2955: 	   [],
 2956: 	   {warnings,[{{3,17},erl_lint,{call_to_redefined_bif,{binary_part,2}}}]}},
 2957: 	  %% If you really mean to call yourself here, you can "unimport" size/1
 2958: 	  {clash6,
 2959:            <<"-export([size/1]).
 2960:               -compile({no_auto_import,[size/1]}).
 2961:               size([]) ->
 2962:                 0;
 2963:               size({N,_}) ->
 2964:                 N;
 2965:               size([_|T]) ->
 2966:                 1+size(T).
 2967:              ">>,
 2968: 	   [],
 2969: 	   []},
 2970: 	  %% Same for the post R14 autoimport warning
 2971: 	  {clash7,
 2972:            <<"-export([binary_part/2]).
 2973:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 2974:               binary_part({B,_},{X,Y}) ->
 2975:                 binary_part(B,{X,Y});
 2976:               binary_part(B,{X,Y}) ->
 2977:                 binary:part(B,X,Y).
 2978:              ">>,
 2979: 	   [],
 2980: 	   []},
 2981:           %% but this doesn't mean the local function is allowed in a guard...
 2982: 	  {clash8,
 2983:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 2984:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 2985:               x(X) when binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= <<1,2>> ->
 2986:                  hej.
 2987:               binary_part({B,_},{X,Y}) ->
 2988:                 binary_part(B,{X,Y});
 2989:               binary_part(B,{X,Y}) ->
 2990:                 binary:part(B,X,Y).
 2991:              ">>,
 2992: 	   [],
 2993: 	   {errors,[{{3,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{binary_part,2}}}],[]}},
 2994:           %% no_auto_import is not like nowarn_bif_clash, it actually removes the autoimport
 2995: 	  {clash9,
 2996:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 2997:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 2998:               x(X) ->
 2999:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= <<1,2>>.
 3000:              ">>,
 3001: 	   [],
 3002: 	   {errors,[{{4,18},erl_lint,{undefined_function,{binary_part,2}}}],[]}},
 3003:           %% but we could import it again...
 3004: 	  {clash10,
 3005:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3006:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3007:               -import(erlang,[binary_part/2]).
 3008:               x(X) ->
 3009:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= <<1,2>>.
 3010:              ">>,
 3011: 	   [],
 3012: 	   []},
 3013:           %% and actually use it in a guard...
 3014: 	  {clash11,
 3015:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3016:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3017:               -import(erlang,[binary_part/2]).
 3018:               x(X) when binary_part(X,{0,1}) =:= <<0>> ->
 3019:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= <<1,2>>.
 3020:              ">>,
 3021: 	   [],
 3022: 	   []},
 3023:           %% but for non-obvious historical reasons, imported functions cannot be used in
 3024: 	  %% fun construction without the module name...
 3025: 	  {clash12,
 3026:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3027:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3028:               -import(erlang,[binary_part/2]).
 3029:               x(X) when binary_part(X,{0,1}) =:= <<0>> ->
 3030:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= fun binary_part/2.
 3031:              ">>,
 3032: 	   [],
 3033: 	   {errors,[{{5,43},erl_lint,{undefined_function,{binary_part,2}}}],[]}},
 3034:           %% Not from erlang and not from anywhere else
 3035: 	  {clash13,
 3036:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3037:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3038:               -import(x,[binary_part/2]).
 3039:               x(X) ->
 3040:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= fun binary_part/2.
 3041:              ">>,
 3042: 	   [],
 3043: 	   {errors,[{{5,43},erl_lint,{undefined_function,{binary_part,2}}}],[]}},
 3044: 	  %% ...while real auto-import is OK.
 3045: 	  {clash14,
 3046:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3047:               x(X) when binary_part(X,{0,1}) =:= <<0>> ->
 3048:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= fun binary_part/2.
 3049:              ">>,
 3050: 	   [],
 3051: 	   []},
 3052:           %% Import directive clashing with old bif is an error, regardless of if it's called or not
 3053: 	  {clash15,
 3054:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3055:               -import(x,[abs/1]).
 3056:               x(X) ->
 3057:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}).
 3058:              ">>,
 3059: 	   [],
 3060: 	   {errors,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{redefine_old_bif_import,{abs,1}}}],[]}},
 3061: 	  %% For a new BIF, it's only a warning
 3062: 	  {clash16,
 3063:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3064:               -import(x,[binary_part/3]).
 3065:               x(X) ->
 3066:                  abs(X).
 3067:              ">>,
 3068: 	   [],
 3069: 	   {warnings,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{redefine_bif_import,{binary_part,3}}}]}},
 3070: 	  %% And, you cannot redefine already imported things that aren't auto-imported
 3071: 	  {clash17,
 3072:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3073:               -import(x,[binary_port/3]).
 3074:               -import(y,[binary_port/3]).
 3075:               x(X) ->
 3076:                  abs(X).
 3077:              ">>,
 3078: 	   [],
 3079: 	   {errors,[{{3,16},erl_lint,{redefine_import,{{binary_port,3},x}}}],[]}},
 3080: 	  %% Not with local functions either
 3081: 	  {clash18,
 3082:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3083:               -import(x,[binary_port/3]).
 3084:               binary_port(A,B,C) ->
 3085:                  binary_part(A,B,C).
 3086:               x(X) ->
 3087:                  abs(X).
 3088:              ">>,
 3089: 	   [],
 3090: 	   {errors,[{{3,15},erl_lint,{define_import,{binary_port,3}}}],[]}},
 3091: 	  %% Like clash8: Dont accept a guard if it's explicitly module-name called either
 3092: 	  {clash19,
 3093:            <<"-export([binary_port/3]).
 3094:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/3]}).
 3095:               -import(x,[binary_part/3]).
 3096:               binary_port(A,B,C) when x:binary_part(A,B,C) ->
 3097:                  binary_part(A,B,C+1).
 3098:              ">>,
 3099: 	   [],
 3100: 	   {errors,[{{4,39},erl_lint,illegal_guard_expr}],[]}},
 3101: 	  %% Not with local functions either
 3102: 	  {clash20,
 3103:            <<"-export([binary_port/3]).
 3104:               -import(x,[binary_part/3]).
 3105:               binary_port(A,B,C) ->
 3106:                  binary_part(A,B,C).
 3107:              ">>,
 3108: 	   [warn_unused_import],
 3109: 	   {warnings,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{redefine_bif_import,{binary_part,3}}}]}},
 3110: 	  %% Don't accept call to a guard BIF if there is a local definition
 3111: 	  %% or an import with the same name. Note: is_record/2 is an
 3112: 	  %% exception, since it is more of syntatic sugar than a real BIF.
 3113: 	  {clash21,
 3114:            <<"-export([is_list/1]).
 3115:               -import(x, [is_tuple/1]).
 3116:               -record(r, {a,b}).
 3117:               x(T) when is_tuple(T) -> ok;
 3118:               x(T) when is_list(T) -> ok.
 3119:               y(T) when is_tuple(T) =:= true -> ok;
 3120:               y(T) when is_list(T) =:= true -> ok;
 3121:               y(T) when is_record(T, r, 3) -> ok;
 3122:               y(T) when is_record(T, r, 3) =:= true -> ok;
 3123:               y(T) when is_record(T, r) =:= true -> ok.
 3124:               is_list(_) ->
 3125:                 ok.
 3126:               is_record(_, _) ->
 3127:                 ok.
 3128:               is_record(_, _, _) ->
 3129:                 ok.
 3130:              ">>,
 3131: 	   [{no_auto_import,[{is_tuple,1}]}],
 3132: 	   {errors,[{{4,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_tuple,1}}},
 3133: 		    {{5,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_list,1}}},
 3134: 		    {{6,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_tuple,1}}},
 3135: 		    {{7,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_list,1}}},
 3136: 		    {{8,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_record,3}}},
 3137: 		    {{9,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_record,3}}}],[]}},
 3138: 	  %% We can also suppress all auto imports at once
 3139: 	  {clash22,
 3140:           <<"-export([size/1, binary_part/2]).
 3141:              -compile(no_auto_import).
 3142:              size([]) ->
 3143:                0;
 3144:              size({N,_}) ->
 3145:                N;
 3146:              size([_|T]) ->
 3147:                1+size(T).
 3148:              binary_part({B,_},{X,Y}) ->
 3149:                binary_part(B,{X,Y});
 3150:              binary_part(B,{X,Y}) ->
 3151:                binary:part(B,X,Y).
 3152:             ">>,
 3153: 	   [],
 3154: 	   []}
 3155: 	 ],
 3156: 
 3157:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 3158:     ok.
 3159: 
 3160: %% Basic tests with one behaviour.
 3161: behaviour_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3162:     Ts = [{behaviour1,
 3163:            <<"-behaviour(application).
 3164:              ">>,

 3292: %% OTP-11861. behaviour_info() and -callback.
 3293: otp_11861(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 3294:     CallbackFiles = [callback1, callback2, callback3,
 3295:                      bad_behaviour1, bad_behaviour2],
 3296:     lists:foreach(fun(M) ->
 3297:                           F = filename:join(?datadir, M),
 3298:                           Opts = [{outdir,?privdir}, return],
 3299:                           {ok, M, []} = compile:file(F, Opts)
 3300:                   end, CallbackFiles),
 3301:     CodePath = code:get_path(),
 3302:     true = code:add_path(?privdir),
 3303:     Ts = [{otp_11861_1,
 3304:            <<"
 3305:               -export([b1/1]).
 3306:               -behaviour(callback1).
 3307:               -behaviour(callback2).
 3308: 
 3309:               -spec b1(atom()) -> integer().
 3310:               b1(A) when is_atom(A)->
 3311:                   3.
 3312:              ">>,
 3313:            [],
 3314:            %% b2/1 is optional in both modules
 3315:            {warnings,[{{4,16},erl_lint,
 3316:                        {conflicting_behaviours,{b1,1},callback2,{3,16},callback1}}]}},
 3317:           {otp_11861_2,
 3318:            <<"
 3319:               -export([b2/1]).
 3320:               -behaviour(callback1).
 3321:               -behaviour(callback2).
 3322: 
 3323:               -spec b2(integer()) -> atom().
 3324:               b2(I) when is_integer(I)->
 3325:                   a.
 3326:              ">>,
 3327:            [],
 3328:            %% b2/1 is optional in callback2, but not in callback1
 3329:            {warnings,[{{3,16},erl_lint,{undefined_behaviour_func,{b1,1},callback1}},
 3330:                       {{4,16},erl_lint,
 3331:                        {conflicting_behaviours,{b2,1},callback2,{3,16},callback1}}]}},
 3332:           {otp_11861_3,
 3333:            <<"
 3334:               -callback b(_) -> atom().
 3335:               -optional_callbacks({b1,1}). % non-existing and ignored
 3336:              ">>,
 3337:            [],
 3338:            []},
 3339:           {otp_11861_4,
 3340:            <<"
 3341:               -callback b(_) -> atom().
 3342:               -optional_callbacks([{b1,1}]). % non-existing
 3343:              ">>,
 3344:            [],
 3345:            %% No behaviour-info(), but callback.
 3346:            {errors,[{{3,16},erl_lint,{undefined_callback,{lint_test,b1,1}}}],[]}},
 3347:           {otp_11861_5,
 3348:            <<"
 3349:               -optional_callbacks([{b1,1}]). % non-existing
 3350:              ">>,
 3351:            [],
 3352:            %% No behaviour-info() and no callback: warning anyway
 3353:            {errors,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{undefined_callback,{lint_test,b1,1}}}],[]}},
 3354:           {otp_11861_6,
 3355:            <<"
 3356:               -optional_callbacks([b1/1]). % non-existing
 3357:               behaviour_info(callbacks) -> [{b1,1}].
 3358:              ">>,
 3359:            [],
 3360:            %% behaviour-info() and no callback: warning anyway
 3361:            {errors,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{undefined_callback,{lint_test,b1,1}}}],[]}},

 3363:            <<"

 3365:               -callback b(_) -> atom().

 3368:            [],

 3372:             []}},

 3486:                   <<A/utf8-unit:1>>.
 3487:

 3489:                   <<A:8/utf16>>.
 3490:               g16(A) ->
 3491:                   <<A:8/utf16-unit:1>>.
 3492:               h16(A) ->
 3493:                   <<A/utf16-unit:1>>.
 3494: 
 3495:               f32(A) ->
 3496:                   <<A:8/utf32>>.
 3497:               g32(A) ->
 3498:                   <<A:8/utf32-unit:1>>.
 3499:               h32(A) ->
 3500:                   <<A/utf32-unit:1>>.
 3501:              ">>,
 3502:            [],
 3503:            {errors,[{{2,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit},
 3504: 		    {{4,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit},

 3518: %% Bugfix: -opaque with invalid type.
 3519: otp_8051(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3520:     Ts = [{otp_8051,

 3528: 
 3529: %% Check that format warnings are generated.
 3530: format_warn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3531:     L1 = 16,
 3532:     L2 = 5,
 3533:     format_level(1, L1, Config),
 3534:     format_level(2, L1+L2, Config),
 3535:     format_level(3, L1+L2, Config),             %there is no level 3
 3536:     ok.
 3537: 
 3538: format_level(Level, Count, Config) ->
 3539:     W = get_compilation_result(Config, "format",
 3540:                                      [{warn_format, Level}]),
 3541:     %% Pick out the 'format' warnings.
 3542:     FW = lists:filter(fun({_Line, erl_lint, {format_error, _}}) -> true;
 3543:                                (_) -> false
 3544:                             end,
 3545:                             W),
 3546:     case length(FW) of
 3547:               Count ->
 3548:                   ok;
 3549:               Other ->
 3550:                   io:format("Expected ~w warning(s); got ~w", [Count,Other]),
 3551:                   fail()
 3552:           end,
 3553:     ok.
 3554: 
 3555: %% Test the -on_load(Name/0) directive.
 3556: 
 3557: 
 3558: on_load_successful(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3559:     Ts = [{on_load_1,
 3560: 	   %% Exported on_load function.
 3561: 	   <<"-export([do_on_load/0]).
 3562:              -on_load(do_on_load/0).
 3563:              do_on_load() -> ok.
 3564:              ">>,
 3565: 	   {[]},				%Tuple indicates no 'export_all'.
 3566: 	   []},
 3567: 
 3568: 	  {on_load_2,
 3569: 	   %% Local on_load function.
 3570: 	   <<"-on_load(do_on_load/0).
 3571:              do_on_load() -> ok.
 3572:              ">>,
 3573: 	   {[]},				%Tuple indicates no 'export_all'.
 3574: 	   []},
 3575: 
 3576: 	  {on_load_3,
 3577: 	   %% Local on_load function, calling other local functions.
 3578: 	   <<"-on_load(do_on_load/0).
 3579:              do_on_load() -> foo().
 3580:              foo() -> bar(5) + 42.
 3581:              bar(N) -> 2*N.
 3582:              ">>,
 3583: 	   {[]},				%Tuple indicates no 'export_all'.
 3584: 	   []}
 3585: 	 ],
 3586:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 3587:     ok.

 3591: 	   %% Badly formed.

 3593:              ">>,
 3594: 	   {[]},				%Tuple indicates no 'export_all'.
 3595: 	   {errors,
 3596: 	    [{{1,22},erl_lint,{bad_on_load,atom}}],[]}},
 3597:

 3599: 	   %% Badly formed.
 3600: 	   <<"-on_load({42,0}).
 3601:              ">>,
 3602: 	   {[]},				%Tuple indicates no 'export_all'.
 3603: 	   {errors,
 3604: 	    [{{1,22},erl_lint,{bad_on_load,{42,0}}}],[]}},
 3605: 
 3606: 	  {on_load_3,
 3607: 	   %% Multiple on_load attributes.
 3608: 	   <<"-on_load(foo/0).
 3609:               -on_load(bar/0).
 3610:               foo() -> ok.
 3611:               bar() -> ok.
 3612:              ">>,
 3613: 	   {[]},				%Tuple indicates no 'export_all'.
 3614: 	   {errors,
 3615: 	    [{{2,16},erl_lint,multiple_on_loads}],[]}},
 3616: 
 3617: 	  {on_load_4,
 3618: 	   %% Wrong arity.
 3619: 	   <<"-on_load(foo/1).
 3620:               foo(_) -> ok.
 3621:              ">>,
 3622: 	   {[]},				%Tuple indicates no 'export_all'.
 3623: 	   {errors,
 3624: 	    [{{1,22},erl_lint,{bad_on_load_arity,{foo,1}}}],[]}},
 3625: 
 3626: 	  {on_load_5,
 3627: 	   %% Non-existing function.
 3628: 	   <<"-on_load(non_existing/0).
 3629:              ">>,
 3630: 	   {[]},				%Tuple indicates no 'export_all'.
 3631: 	   {errors,
 3632: 	    [{{1,22},erl_lint,{undefined_on_load,{non_existing,0}}}],[]}}
 3633: 	 ],
 3634:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 3635:     ok.

 3679:               f3() -> fun record_info/2.">>,

 3698: %% Test binary syntax errors
 3699: bin_syntax_errors(Config) ->
 3700:     Ts = [{bin_syntax_errors,
 3701: 	   <<"t(<<X:bad_size>>) -> X;
 3702: 	      t(<<_:(x ! y)/integer>>) -> ok;
 3703: 	      t(<<_:(l())/integer>>) -> ok;
 3704:               t(<<X:all/integer>>) -> X;
 3705:               t(<<X/bad_type>>) -> X;
 3706: 	      t(<<X/unit:8>>) -> X;
 3707: 	      t(<<X:7/float>>) -> X;
 3708: 	      t(<< <<_:8>> >>) -> ok;
 3709: 	      t(<<(x ! y):8/integer>>) -> ok;
 3710:               t(X) ->
 3711:                 {<<X/binary-integer>>,<<X/signed-unsigned-integer>>,
 3712:                  <<X/little-big>>,<<X/unit:4-unit:8>>};
 3713:               t(<<_:{A,B}>>) -> ok.
 3714: 
 3715:               l() ->
 3716:                   foo.
 3717: 	    ">>,
 3718: 	   [],
 3719: 	   {error,[{{2,17},erl_lint,illegal_bitsize},
 3720: 		   {{3,15},erl_lint,{illegal_bitsize_local_call,{l,0}}},
 3721: 		   {{5,19},erl_lint,{undefined_bittype,bad_type}},
 3722: 		   {{6,12},erl_lint,bittype_unit},
 3723: 		   {{8,13},erl_lint,illegal_pattern},
 3724: 		   {{9,15},erl_lint,illegal_pattern},
 3725: 		   {{11,20},erl_lint,{bittype_mismatch,integer,binary,"type"}},
 3726: 		   {{11,41},erl_lint,{bittype_mismatch,unsigned,signed,"sign"}},
 3727: 		   {{12,20},erl_lint,{bittype_mismatch,big,little,"endianness"}},
 3728: 		   {{12,37},erl_lint,{bittype_mismatch,8,4,"unit"}},
 3729:                    {{13,22},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'A'}},
 3730:                    {{13,24},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'B'}}
 3731: 		  ],
 3732: 	    [{{1,27},erl_lint,non_integer_bitsize},
 3733:              {{4,21},erl_lint,non_integer_bitsize},
 3734:              {{7,12},erl_lint,{bad_bitsize,"float"}},
 3735:              {{13,21},erl_lint,non_integer_bitsize}]}}
 3736: 	 ],
 3737:     [] = run(Config, Ts),

 4019: %% OTP-11879: The -spec f/a :: (As) -> B; syntax removed,

 4021: otp_11879(_Config) ->
 4022:     Fs = [{attribute,0,file,{"file.erl",0}},
 4023:           {attribute,0,module,m},
 4024:           {attribute,1,spec,
 4025:            {{f,1},
 4026:             [{type,2,'fun',[{type,3,product,[{var,4,'V1'},
 4027:                                              {var,5,'V1'}]},
 4028:                             {type,6,integer,[]}]}]}},
 4029:           {attribute,20,callback,
 4030:            {{cb,21},
 4031:             [{type,22,'fun',[{type,23,product,[{var,24,'V1'},
 4032:                                                {var,25,'V1'}]},
 4033:                              {type,6,integer,[]}]}]}}],
 4034:     {error,[{"file.erl",
 4035:              [{1,erl_lint,{spec_fun_undefined,{f,1}}},
 4036:               {2,erl_lint,spec_wrong_arity},
 4037:               {22,erl_lint,callback_wrong_arity}]}],
 4038:      []} = compile_forms(Fs, [return,report]),
 4039:     ok.
 4040: 
 4041: compile_forms(Terms, Opts) ->
 4042:     Forms = [erl_parse:anno_from_term(Term) || Term <- Terms],
 4043:     compile:forms(Forms, Opts).

 4113: %% OTP-14285: We currently don't support non-latin1 module names.
 4114: 
 4115: non_latin1_module(Config) ->
 4116:     Expected = [non_latin1_module_unsupported],
 4117:     Expected = check_module_name('юникод'),
 4118:     Expected = check_module_name(list_to_atom([256,$a,$b,$c])),
 4119:     Expected = check_module_name(list_to_atom([$a,$b,256,$c])),
 4120: 
 4121:     "module names with non-latin1 characters are not supported" =
 4122:         format_error(non_latin1_module_unsupported),
 4123:     BadCallback =
 4124:         {bad_callback,{'кирилли́ческий атом','кирилли́ческий атом',0}},
 4125:     BadModule =
 4126:         {bad_module,{'кирилли́ческий атом','кирилли́ческий атом',0}},
 4127:     "explicit module not allowed for callback "
 4128:     "'кирилли́ческий атом':'кирилли́ческий атом'/0" =
 4129:         format_error(BadCallback),
 4130:     UndefBehav = {undefined_behaviour,'кирилли́ческий атом'},
 4131:     "behaviour 'кирилли́ческий атом' undefined" =
 4132:         format_error(UndefBehav),
 4133:     Ts = [{non_latin1_module,
 4134:            <<"
 4135:             %% Report uses of module names with non-Latin-1 characters.
 4136: 
 4137:             -import('кирилли́ческий атом', []).
 4138:             -behaviour('кирилли́ческий атом').
 4139:             -behavior('кирилли́ческий атом').
 4140: 
 4141:             -callback 'кирилли́ческий атом':'кирилли́ческий атом'() -> a.
 4142: 
 4143:             %% erl_lint:gexpr/3 is not extended to check module name here:
 4144:             t1() when 'кирилли́ческий атом':'кирилли́ческий атом'(1) ->
 4145:                 b.
 4146: 
 4147:             t2() ->
 4148:                 'кирилли́ческий атом':'кирилли́ческий атом'().
 4149: 
 4150:             -spec 'кирилли́ческий атом':'кирилли́ческий атом'() -> atom().
 4151: 
 4152:             -spec 'кирилли́ческий атом'(integer()) ->
 4153:               'кирилли́ческий атом':'кирилли́ческий атом'().
 4154: 
 4155:             'кирилли́ческий атом'(1) ->
 4156:                 'кирилли́ческий атом':f(),
 4157:                 F = f,
 4158:                 'кирилли́ческий атом':F()."/utf8>>,
 4159:            [],
 4160:            {error,
 4161:             [{{4,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4162:              {{5,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4163:              {{6,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4164:              {{8,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4165:              {{8,14},erl_lint,BadCallback},
 4166:              {{11,23},erl_lint,illegal_guard_expr},
 4167:              {{15,17},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4168:              {{17,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4169:              {{17,14},erl_lint,BadModule},
 4170:              {{20,15},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4171:              {{23,17},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4172:              {{25,17},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported}],
 4173:             [{{5,14},erl_lint,UndefBehav},
 4174:              {{6,14},erl_lint,UndefBehav}]}}],
 4175:     run(Config, Ts),
 4176:     ok.
 4177: 
 4178: illegal_module_name(_Config) ->
 4179:     [empty_module_name] = check_module_name(''),
 4180: 
 4181:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('\x00'),
 4182:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('abc\x1F'),
 4183:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('\x7F'),
 4184:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('abc\x80'),
 4185:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('abc\x80xyz'),
 4186:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('\x9Fxyz'),
 4187: 
 4188:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name,
 4189:      non_latin1_module_unsupported] = check_module_name('атом\x00'),
 4190: 
 4191:     [blank_module_name] = check_module_name(' '),
 4192:     [blank_module_name] = check_module_name('\xA0'),
 4193:     [blank_module_name] = check_module_name('\xAD'),
 4194:     [blank_module_name] = check_module_name('  \xA0\xAD '),
 4195: 
 4196:     %% White space and soft hyphens are OK if there are visible
 4197:     %% characters in the name.
 4198:     ok = check_module_name(' abc '),
 4199:     ok = check_module_name('abc '),
 4200:     ok = check_module_name(' abc '),
 4201:     ok = check_module_name(' abc xyz '),
 4202:     ok = check_module_name(' abc\xADxyz '),
 4203: 
 4204:     ok.
 4205: 
 4206: check_module_name(Mod) ->
 4207:     File = atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl",
 4208:     L1 = erl_anno:new(1),
 4209:     Forms = [{attribute,L1,file,{File,1}},
 4210:              {attribute,L1,module,Mod},
 4211:              {eof,2}],
 4212:     _ = compile:forms(Forms),
 4213:     case compile:forms(Forms, [return]) of
 4214:         {error,Errors,[]} ->
 4215:             [{_ModName,L}] = Errors,
 4216:             lists:sort([Reason || {1,erl_lint,Reason} <- L]);
 4217:         {ok,Mod,Code,Ws} when is_binary(Code), is_list(Ws)  ->
 4218:             ok
 4219:     end.
 4220: 
 4221: otp_14378(Config) ->
 4222:     Ts = [

 4430: one_multi_init(Config) ->
 4431:     "'_' initializes no omitted fields" =
 4432:         format_error(bad_multi_field_init),
 4433:     Ts = [{otp_16516_1,
 4434:            <<"-record(r, {f}).
 4435:               t(#r{f = 17, _ = V}) ->
 4436:                   V.
 4437:               u(#r{_ = V, f = 17}) ->
 4438:                   V.
 4439:               -record(r1, {f, g = 17}).
 4440:               g(#r1{f = 3, _ = 42}) ->
 4441:                 g.
 4442:              ">>,
 4443:            [],
 4444:            {errors,[{{2,28},erl_lint,bad_multi_field_init},
 4445:                     {{4,20},erl_lint,bad_multi_field_init}],[]}},
 4446:           {otp_16516_2,
 4447:            %% No error since "_ = '_'" is actually used as a catch-all
 4448:            %% initialization. V is unused (as compilation with the 'E'
 4449:            %% option shows), but no warning about V being unused is
 4450:            %% output.
 4451:            <<"-record(r, {f}).
 4452:               t(V) ->
 4453:                   #r{f = 3, _ = V}.
 4454:               u(V) ->
 4455:                   #r{_ = V, f = 3}.
 4456:              ">>,
 4457:            [],
 4458:            []},
 4459:           {otp_16516_3,
 4460:            %% No error in this case either. And no unused variable warning.
 4461:            <<"-record(r, {f}).
 4462:               t(V) when #r{f = 3, _ = V} =:= #r{f = 3} ->
 4463:                   a.
 4464:               u(V) when #r{_ = V, f = 3} =:= #r{f = 3} ->
 4465:                   a.
 4466:              ">>,
 4467:            [],
 4468:            []}],
 4469:     [] = run(Config, Ts).
 4470:

 4732:            {[]},
 4733:            {warnings,[{{1,22},erl_lint,{unused_type,{t1,0}}},
 4734:                       {{2,16},erl_lint,{unused_type,{t2,0}}},
 4735:                       {{3,16},erl_lint,{unused_function,{t,0}}}]}},
 4736:           {unused_type2_3,
 4737:            <<"-callback cb() -> t().
 4738:               -type t() :: atom().
 4739:                t() ->
 4740:                    a.
 4741:             ">>,
 4742:            {[]},
 4743:            {warnings,[{{3,16},erl_lint,{unused_function,{t,0}}}]}},
 4744:           {unused_type2_4,
 4745:            <<"-spec t() -> t().
 4746:               -type t() :: atom().
 4747:                t() ->
 4748:                    a.
 4749:             ">>,
 4750:            {[]},
 4751:            {warnings,[{{3,16},erl_lint,{unused_function,{t,0}}}]}},
 4752:           {unused_type2_5,
 4753:            <<"-export_type([t/0]).
 4754:               -type t() :: atom().
 4755:                t() ->
 4756:                    a.
 4757:             ">>,
 4758:            {[]},
 4759:            {warnings,[{{3,16},erl_lint,{unused_function,{t,0}}}]}},
 4760:           {unused_type2_6,
 4761:            <<"-record(r, {f :: t()}).
 4762:               -type t() :: atom().
 4763:                t() ->
 4764:                    a.
 4765:             ">>,
 4766:            {[]},
 4767:            {warnings,[{{1,22},erl_lint,{unused_record,r}},
 4768:                       {{3,16},erl_lint,{unused_function,{t,0}}}]}}
 4769:          ],
 4770:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 4771: 
 4772:     ok.
 4773: 
 4774: %% Test maybe ... else ... end.
 4775: eep49(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4776:     EnableMaybe = {feature,maybe_expr,enable},
 4777:     Ts = [{exp1,
 4778:            <<"t(X) ->
 4779:                   maybe
 4780:                       A = X()
 4781:                   end,
 4782:                   A.
 4783:            ">>,
 4784:            [EnableMaybe],
 4785:            {errors,[{{5,19},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'A',{'maybe',{2,19}}}}],
 4786:             []}},
 4787: 
 4788:           {exp2,
 4789:            <<"t(X) ->
 4790:                   maybe
 4791:                       A = X()
 4792:                   else
 4793:                       _ -> {ok,A}
 4794:                   end,
 4795:                   A.
 4796:            ">>,
 4797:            [EnableMaybe],
 4798:            {errors,[{{5,32},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'A',{'maybe',{2,19}}}},
 4799:                     {{7,19},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'A',{'maybe',{2,19}}}}],
 4800:             []}},
 4801: 
 4802:           {exp3,
 4803:            <<"t(X) ->
 4804:                   maybe
 4805:                       X()
 4806:                   else
 4807:                       A ->
 4808:                           B = 42,
 4809:                           {error,A}
 4810:                   end,
 4811:                   {A,B}.
 4812:            ">>,
 4813:            [EnableMaybe],
 4814:            {errors,[{{9,20},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'A',{'else',{4,19}}}},
 4815:                     {{9,22},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'B',{'else',{4,19}}}}],
 4816:             []}},
 4817: 
 4818:           {exp4,
 4819:            <<"t(X) ->
 4820:                   maybe
 4821:                       X()
 4822:                   else
 4823:                       ok ->
 4824:                           A = 42;
 4825:                       error ->
 4826:                           error
 4827:                   end,
 4828:                   A.
 4829:            ">>,
 4830:            [EnableMaybe],
 4831:            {errors,[{{10,19},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'A',{'else',{4,19}}}}],
 4832:             []}},
 4833: 
 4834:           %% Using '?=' not at the top-level of a 'maybe' ... 'else' is forbidden.
 4835:           {illegal_maybe_match1,
 4836:            <<"t(X) ->
 4837:                   maybe (ok ?= X()) end.
 4838:            ">>,
 4839:            [EnableMaybe],
 4840:            {errors,[{{2,29},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","'?='"]}],[]}},
 4841:           {illegal_maybe_match2,
 4842:            <<"t(X) ->
 4843:                   ok ?= X().
 4844:            ">>,
 4845:            [EnableMaybe],
 4846:            {errors,[{{2,22},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","'?='"]}],[]}}
 4847:          ],
 4848: 
 4849:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 4850:     ok.
 4851: 
 4852: format_error(E) ->
 4853:     lists:flatten(erl_lint:format_error(E)).
 4854: 
 4855: run(Config, Tests) ->
 4856:     F = fun({N,P,Ws,E}, BadL) ->
 4857:                 io:format("### ~s\n", [N]),
 4858:                 case catch run_test(Config, P, Ws) of
 4859:                     E -> 
 4860:                         BadL;
 4861:                     Bad -> 
 4862:                         io:format("~nTest ~p failed. Expected~n  ~p~n"
 4863:                                   "but got~n  ~p~n", [N, E, Bad]),
 4864: 			fail()
 4865:                 end
 4866:         end,
 4867:     lists:foldl(F, [], Tests).
 4868: 
 4869: %% Compiles a test file and returns the list of warnings/errors.
 4870: 
 4871: get_compilation_result(Conf, Filename, Warnings) ->
 4872:     DataDir = ?datadir,
 4873:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Filename),
 4874:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(File++".erl"),
 4875:     FileS = binary_to_list(Bin),
 4876:     {match,[{Start,Length}|_]} = re:run(FileS, "-module.*\\n"),
 4877:     Test = lists:nthtail(Start+Length, FileS),
 4878:     case run_test(Conf, Test, Warnings) of
 4879:         {warnings, Ws} -> Ws;
 4880:         {errors,Es,Ws} -> {Es,Ws};
 4881:         [] -> []
 4882:     end.
 4883: 
 4884: %% Compiles a test module and returns the list of errors and warnings.
 4885: 
 4886: run_test(Conf, Test0, Warnings0) ->
 4887:     Test = list_to_binary(["-module(lint_test). ", Test0]),
 4888:     run_test2(Conf, Test, Warnings0).
 4889: 
 4890: run_test2(Conf, Test, Warnings0) ->
 4891:     Filename = "lint_test.erl",
 4892:     DataDir = ?privdir,
 4893:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Filename),
 4894:     Opts = case Warnings0 of
 4895:                {Warnings} ->		%Hairy trick to not add export_all.
 4896:                    [return|Warnings];
 4897:                Warnings ->
 4898:                    [export_all,return|Warnings]
 4899:            end,
 4900:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 4901: 
 4902:     %% We will use the 'binary' option so that the compiler will not
 4903:     %% compare the module name to the output file name. Also, there
 4904:     %% is no reason to produce an output file since we are only
 4905:     %% interested in the errors and warnings.
 4906: 
 4907:     %% Print warnings, call erl_lint:format_error/1. (But note that
 4908:     %% the compiler will ignore failing calls to erl_lint:format_error/1.)
 4909:     compile:file(File, [binary,report|Opts]),
 4910: 
 4911:     case compile:file(File, [binary|Opts]) of
 4912:         {ok, _M, Code, Ws} when is_binary(Code) ->
 4913:             warnings(File, Ws, Test);
 4914:         {error, [{File,Es}], []} ->
 4915:             print_diagnostics(Es, Test),
 4916: 	    {errors, call_format_error(Es), []};
 4917:         {error, [{File,Es}], [{File,Ws}]} ->
 4918:             print_diagnostics(Es, Test),
 4919:             print_diagnostics(Ws, Test),
 4920: 	    {error, call_format_error(Es), call_format_error(Ws)};
 4921:         {error, [{File,Es1},{File,Es2}], []} ->
 4922:             print_diagnostics(Es1, Test),
 4923:             print_diagnostics(Es2, Test),
 4924: 	    {errors2, Es1, Es2}
 4925:     end.
 4926: 
 4927: warnings(File, Ws, Source) ->
 4928:     case lists:append([W || {F, W} <- Ws, F =:= File]) of
 4929:         [] ->
 4930: 	    [];
 4931:         L ->
 4932:             print_diagnostics(L, Source),
 4933: 	    {warnings, call_format_error(L)}
 4934:     end.
 4935: 
 4936: call_format_error(L) ->
 4937:     %% Smoke test of format_error/1 to make sure that no crashes
 4938:     %% slip through.
 4939:     _ = [Mod:format_error(Term) || {_,Mod,Term} <- L],
 4940:     L.
 4941: 
 4942: print_diagnostics(Warnings, Source) ->
 4943:     case binary:match(Source, <<"-file(">>) of
 4944:         nomatch ->
 4945:             Lines = binary:split(Source, <<"\n">>, [global]),
 4946:             Cs = [print_diagnostic(W, Lines) || W <- Warnings],
 4947:             io:put_chars(Cs);
 4948:         _ ->
 4949:             %% There are probably fake line numbers greater than
 4950:             %% the number of actual lines.
 4951:             ok
 4952:     end.
 4953: 
 4954: print_diagnostic({{LineNum,Column},Mod,Data}, Lines) ->
 4955:     Line0 = lists:nth(LineNum, Lines),
 4956:     <<Line1:(Column-1)/binary,_/binary>> = Line0,
 4957:     Spaces = re:replace(Line1, <<"[^\t]">>, <<" ">>, [global]),
 4958:     CaretLine = [Spaces,"^"],
 4959:     [io_lib:format("~p:~p: ~ts\n", [LineNum,Column,Mod:format_error(Data)]),
 4960:      Line0, "\n",
 4961:      CaretLine, "\n\n"];
 4962: print_diagnostic(_, _) ->
 4963:     [].
 4964: 
 4965: fail() ->
 4966:     ct:fail(failed).
